factory.title: Factory Method
factory.description:
Factory Method â€” creational design pattern that defines a common interface for creating objects, allowing subclasses to decide which class to instantiate. Works with abstractions instead of concrete classes, simplifies extension and maintenance.

In the classical implementation, the pattern uses an interface that concrete classes implement. In this Angular example, we use an abstract class (NotificationAbstract) instead, because it allows us to define common properties (like message) and optionally provide shared methods while still enforcing a contract for subclasses.
factory.step1:
Step 1: Create Notification Framework
Define NotificationAbstract as a base for all notifications, declaring common methods like show().
factory.step2:
Step 2: Develop SuccessNotification
Create NotificationSuccess class, extending NotificationAbstract, and implement show() for success messages.
factory.step3:
Step 3: Develop ErrorNotification
Create NotificationError class, extending NotificationAbstract, and implement show() for error messages.
factory.step4:
Step 4: Develop WarningNotification
Create NotificationWarning class, extending NotificationAbstract, and implement show() for warning messages.
factory.step5:
Step 5: Create NotificationFactory Service
Encapsulate creation logic depending on notification type in NotificationFactoryService.
factory.step6:
Step 6: Use Factory Pattern in Component
Demonstrate the Factory Method pattern in FactoryPatternComponent, working only with abstractions.

abstractFactory.title: Abstract Factory
abstractFactory.description: Abstract Factory is a creational design pattern that provides an interface for creating families of related objects without specifying their concrete classes.
abstractFactory.step1:
Step 1: Define Abstract Button
Create an abstract Button class declaring the render() method.
abstractFactory.step2:
Step 2: Define Abstract Checkbox
Create an abstract Checkbox class declaring the render() method.
abstractFactory.step3:
Step 3: Implement LightButton
Extend ButtonAbstract and implement the render() method for the light theme.
abstractFactory.step4:
Step 4: Implement LightCheckbox
Extend CheckboxAbstract and implement the render() method for the light theme.
abstractFactory.step5:
Step 5: Implement DarkButton
Extend ButtonAbstract and implement the render() method for the dark theme.
abstractFactory.step6:
Step 6: Implement DarkCheckbox
Extend CheckboxAbstract and implement the render() method for the dark theme.
abstractFactory.step7:
Step 7: Define ThemeFactoryAbstract
Declare methods to create Button and Checkbox.
abstractFactory.step10:
Step 10: Create AbstractFactoryService
Provide a specific factory based on the selected theme.
abstractFactory.step11:
Step 11: Build AbstractFactoryComponent
Demonstrate creating UI elements from Light or Dark factories.
